data.title: Choose the correct answer for each question

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'air' in a sentence.

words.word: I opened the window to let in some fresh air.
I opened the window to let in some fresh heir.
I opened the window to let in some fresh err.

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'heir' in a sentence.

words.word: He is the heir to the throne.
He is the air to the throne.
He is the err to the throne.

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'err' in a sentence.

words.word: To err is human, to forgive divine.
To air is human, to forgive divine.
To heir is human, to forgive divine.

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'cue' in a sentence.

words.word: That was your cue to enter the stage.
That was your queue to enter the stage.
That was your kew to enter the stage.

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'queue' in a sentence.

words.word: We had to wait in a long queue for tickets.
We had to wait in a long cue for tickets.
We had to wait in a long kew for tickets.

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'kew' in a sentence.

words.word: Kew Gardens is a famous botanical garden in London.
Queue Gardens is a famous botanical garden in London.
Cue Gardens is a famous botanical garden in London.

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'cite' in a sentence.

words.word: The professor will cite several sources in her article.
The professor will site several sources in her article.
The professor will sight several sources in her article.

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'site' in a sentence.

words.word: The construction site is off-limits to visitors.
The construction cite is off-limits to visitors.
The construction sight is off-limits to visitors.

sections.explain: Correct usage of the word 'sight' in a sentence.

words.word: The mountain view was a breathtaking sight.
The mountain view was a breathtaking site.
The mountain view was a breathtaking cite.
